noun.description: The fact or condition of functioning or being active.
examples: the construction and operation of power stations
some of these ideas could be put into operation

noun.description: An act of surgery performed on a patient.
A piece of organized and concerted activity involving a number of people, especially members of the armed forces or the police.
A process in which a number, quantity, expression, etc., is altered or manipulated according to formal rules, such as those of addition, multiplication, and differentiation.

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin operatio(n-), from the verb operari expend labor on (see operate).
